meanings.definition: The act of ending a phrase or sentence with a cadence.
meanings.sent1: Her cadencing at the end of the speech was powerful.
meanings.sent2: The cadencing of the poem gave it a nice flow.
meanings.sent3: The cadencing of his joke made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: The cadencing of the story left us all in suspense.
meanings.sent5: The cadencing of the melody lingered in the air.

meanings.definition: The rhythm or flow of a piece of music or writing.
meanings.sent1: The cadencing of the song was catchy and easy to follow.
meanings.sent2: His writing had a beautiful cadencing that captivated the readers.
meanings.sent3: The cadencing of the dance made everyone want to join in.
meanings.sent4: The cadencing of the waves against the shore was soothing.
meanings.sent5: The cadencing of the story kept me engaged till the end.

meanings.definition: To mark the rhythm or beat of a piece of music or writing.
meanings.sent1: She was cadencing the music with her conducting.
meanings.sent2: Cadencing the poem aloud helped the students understand its flow.
meanings.sent3: He cadenced the drumbeat with a playful rhythm.
meanings.sent4: Cadencing the steps, she danced gracefully across the stage.
meanings.sent5: The conductor cadencing the orchestra brought the piece to life.
